page.title: 20Kelso Square
page.content: Kelso Square is in the centre of Kelso and is one of the most interesting parts of the town. In days gone by, the Square used to be a{marketplace and you can still see the{bullring where the bulls were tied up on market days. The Square was built in{1816 although some of the buildings are older. In 1962, the{Queen and Prince {Philip}visited our Square. They put some commemorative coins in the casket below the bullring. The{British {Council of Archaeology}has declared Kelso a town of architectural value - the only one in the Borders. Nowadays the Square is used for all sorts of events like parades, charity stalls, displays, pipe bands and dancing. The {Town Hall}and the{Cross Keys Hotel, which used to be a stopping point on the London-Edinburgh stagecoach route, are the most important buildings.
